text: you know as time passes things change
and we change and i hope you remember
what i always say if something doesn't
work for you or has stopped working
switch things up i'm no exception
so there are things that i have changed
and there are things that i no longer
have the need to do in order to improve
my english as funny or shocking as it
may sound for some people i still work
on my english there's so much i still
don't know but i have definitely moved
forward my english has improved
significantly and things that worked for
me two years a year or even half a year
ago aren't working anymore but i also
share things that i still do or have
started doing so i'm going to be
referring to a couple of my videos where
i shared my study routine if you're
interested i'll link them in the
description one more thing i'm not
saying that those things aren't
effective and you shouldn't do them it's
just there comes a time where you either
need to change something or you realize
that you no longer need them the first
thing i no longer do is i don't write
down unknown words i want to learn
writing down just one word by itself is
worthless for me even if i go back to
that word later i need context without
context it's just not going to stick
with me of course there's different
techniques to help you memorize new
words like come up with sentences using
them or come up with a story using them
but they only work if you follow through
with them but do you really come up with
sentences for every word you write down
if you do then bravo you rock but
writing by hand nonetheless works like a
charm for remembering things
and what i do do
is i write down phrases that i find
interesting including phrases with words
i want to learn and want to be able to
use them
or phrases that i find difficult to
pronounce and i want to be able to say
easily and naturally but i don't just
write them down i practice saying them
until i feel that i've got them usually
those are the phrases that grab my
attention when i watch something
a huge plus of doing this is that you're
using material that has already been put
together you're copying native speakers
thus making sure that the vocabulary you
use sounds natural furthermore i have a
journal where i write about my feelings
and thoughts
in english of course
i did that and still do
i write posts for my instagram in
english and i script my videos in
english these things have already become
habitual for me and let me remind you
once again when you write in english
you're not in a hurry usually you have
the time to think about grammar and the
best or more suitable wording
and find appropriate synonyms for the
words that you know you use most often
and it's a great way to learn new words
i no longer practice my pronunciation
every day i used to practice my
pronunciation every single day as much
as possible and the biggest chunk of it
i did in the morning i would practice
tongue twisters do my speaking exercises
work on the sounds words and word pairs
that were difficult to pronounce then
also during the day and when we watched
something i would always shadow i still
practice my pronunciation these days but
do it much less and i'm not that
obsessive for two reasons one it's
become easier for me to speak english
because i practiced my pronunciation so
that i wouldn't stumble over my words as
much as i did previously and two
i've become more relaxed about it and
not because i think that my
pronunciation is perfect and i have
nothing to improve anymore but simply
because i'm not chasing perfection any
longer now i practice because i truly
enjoy honing my skills i no longer check
every other word when watching or
reading something i still come across
words i don't know all the time and i do
check their meanings when i want to or
need to or am curious about them even so
it's become so much easier to remember
them and their meanings and also it's
become easier to guess the meanings
based on the context i no longer check
in with grammar rules every time i want
to say something or write something or
when i've heard or seen an interesting
sentence structure because that's what i
used to do my brain works in a way that
i always want to know why and how i used
to read and try to memorize grammar
rules and tense formulas like i was
getting ready for an exam or something
but that didn't quite work for me
although it wasn't worthless when you're
trying to understand how to use certain
grammar constructions you need examples
and context
and then you need to use that and then
you need repetition because the more you
use something the better you start to
understand that and the better you
memorize that so what i really needed
wasn't reading grammar rules but rather
implementation of those rules the actual
usage when you hear something in context
and understand what is being talked
about and then use it yourself that's
what helped me the most now i just speak
and when i feel like something didn't
sound quite right i think for a bit and
correct myself or just let it go and
make a mental note of my mistake
try to analyze it and try not to make it
again and when i write something my
grammar for the most part isn't that bad
but i am able to do that now because i
did check in with the grammar rules
after all it was time consuming and
exhausting and boring in a way but the
thing is that you're not gonna do that
for the rest of your life there comes a
time when you become used to the
language and your brain accumulates
enough knowledge and starts actively
using it and suddenly it becomes easier
you just need to push through this
difficult period and stay consistent
there are certainly times when i do need
to check in with grammar and read those
grammar rules once again because i still
don't know a lot of things or might not
remember something and i still make
mistakes but it's not at all hard for me
right now i barely even notice that i'm
checking something because i have built
really strong habits over the years
which no longer seem demanding or are no
longer difficult
they are just part of what i
automatically do
listening and immersing yourself in the
language is of course a big part of it
and speaking of immersion i know that
this is a tough one that's why i want to
suggest that you try lingoda they are
sponsors of this portion of the video
lingoda is an online language school
their classes are available 24 7 and
they offer a highly immersive learning
experience and this is what we need and
are looking for right and this is what a
lot of people find difficult to
implement how do you even immerse
yourself in the language not being in
the country where they speak that
language and how do you structure your
study routine that's why i think that
lingoda is a perfect place for this as
you'll be learning with native speaking
qualified teachers who will be able to
answer all of your questions about
grammar and the language you can have
one-on-one or small group classes that
are created by a team of linguistics
experts and there are five lesson types
speaking communication vocabulary
grammar and reading so this holistic
approach allows you to improve on
everything you need as you can see they
offer a monthly subscription and
marathon courses a monthly subscription
is a great option to stay consistent and
to always keep your target language in a
good shape whereas a marathon is a
perfect option for someone who needs to
refresh their knowledge or needs quick
and efficient results which by the way
as a reward and motivation for a
completion you can get some cash back
lingoda has courses suited for
everyone's language level and needs you
get to pick how often you take classes
and which topics you cover you cannot go
wrong with this one moreover if you

in my video about my study routine i
said that i used stickers on which i
wrote words idioms and so on that i
wanted to memorize and stuck them
everywhere i could see and read them all
the time i no longer have the need to do
that
now i just checked the meaning of the
word online once maybe twice and now
that's enough for me to remember it
again i guess over time your brain just
gets so used to english that it
memorizes new information easily i still
watch and read ninety percent of the
content i consume in english i search
for all information in english thus
increasing my reading time in english i
still mostly follow native speakers or
people who post in english on social
media over time you become so accustomed
to doing all this and your brain adapts
to english so much that when you think
you think in english and when you want
to say something in english you just
know how to say it because you've heard
it enough times for your brain to just
suggest it to you and needless to say i
still speak english with my son all the
time but you know till this day i have a
lot of like aha moments like oh that's
what it means or that's what they said
whenever i watch or hear something that
i have watched and heard before but for
some reason couldn't make out okay guys
take whatever you need from the

yourself until the next
